citeinfo.title: Electrical and Seismic Response of Saline Permafrost Soil during Freeze - Thaw Transition: Supporting Data

descript.abstract:
Saline permafrost core from site 0 transect at 260-280cm below ground surface.
Dataset citation: Yuxin Wu, Seiji Nakagawa, Timothy J. Kneafsey. 2017. Electrical and Seismic Response of Saline Permafrost Soil during Freeze - Thaw Transition: Supporting Data. Next Generation Ecosystem Experiments Arctic Data Collection, Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA. Data accessed at http://dx.doi.org/10.5440/1374172.
descript.purpose: Data collected to better understand geophysical properties of saline permafrost.

qattracc.attraccv: Data uncertainty mainly come from instrument uncertainty, generally <1% for resistivity, and 0.5 mrads for phase measurements at < 1000 Hz.

dataqual.logic: The data reported here is consistent with existing data in literature.
dataqual.complete: The datasets are reported with less density than original measured, i.e. figure plot generated with data from once every a few measurements following a time sequence.

method.methdesc: Saline sample was inserted in a sample holder and support and setup inside a T-controllable refrigerator. Then electrical and seismic measurements were made with step wised T control

cntperp.cntorg: Next-Generation Ecosystem Experiments (NGEE) Arctic Project, Oak Ridge National Laboratory

metainfo.metstdn: FDGC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata and Biological Data Profile

ome.datause: The data were collected during a repeat freeze-thaw cycle of the cores to understand mechanical and geophysical property changes over time. Unfrozen water content was calculated based on a modified Archie's law.
